title: Rotator Cuff Injury Case Study: A 45-Year-Old Male with Shoulder Pain
clinical_history: A 45-year-old male, who works as a construction worker, presents with a 3-week history of right shoulder pain. He reports that the pain started after a fall while working on a scaffolding at a construction site. He felt a sudden sharp pain in his shoulder and was unable to move his arm. He has been experiencing pain and stiffness in his shoulder since then, which has been affecting his daily activities and sleep. He has difficulty lifting his arm above 90 degrees and has weakness in his shoulder, particularly when trying to lift objects or perform overhead activities.

nprs.affected_area: right shoulder, specifically over the deltoid region
right upper arm and forearm, particularly with movement

aggrevating_factors: Lifting heavy objects, overhead activities, reaching behind his back, and sleeping on the affected side
picture: A 24-hour picture showing the patient with his arm in a sling, with an ice pack applied to the affected area
easing_factors: Rest, ice application, and physical therapy interventions such as gentle mobilization and strengthening exercises
past_history: Previous history of shoulder injuries, including a dislocated shoulder 10 years ago, which was managed conservatively. He has also had episodes of lower back pain, which he manages with occasional physical therapy and exercise.
medical_history: Generally healthy, but with a history of hypertension, which is well-controlled with medication.
medications: Acetaminophen 1000mg every 4-6 hours as needed for pain, and a daily multivitamin.
personal_history: Married with two children, works full-time as a construction worker, and enjoys weekend golfing and hiking. He reports increased stress levels due to work-related demands and family responsibilities.
imaging: X-rays of the right shoulder show no evidence of fractures or dislocations. An MRI of the right shoulder reveals a partial tear of the supraspinatus tendon and tendinopathy of the infraspinatus tendon.
